keyMoments.description: Despite her fear of pirates and blood, Dr. Kobato decides to help Nami and Chopper reach Dock 88, stating they taught her what it means to be a doctor
keyMoments.significance: Character defining moment showing her moral growth and willingness to help those who deserve it regardless of their pirate status

relationships.description: Helped by Nami during medical crisis, now helps her in return
Fellow doctor who taught her important medical values

keyMoments.description: Left behind in prison while still being called 'Condoriano' by the guards, unable to convince anyone of his true identity despite desperate protests
keyMoments.significance: Continues one of the G-8 Arc's most beloved running gags that became a lasting One Piece meme

relationships.description: Victim of Usopp's deception that created the Condoriano identity

keyMoments.description: Successfully sets up an ambush at Dock 88 as ordered by Vice Admiral Jonathan, trapping the Straw Hats with overwhelming numbers
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his competence as a Marine officer and Jonathan's effective tactical planning

keyMoments.description: Orders the use of a Seastone net against Luffy, successfully neutralizing the Devil Fruit user
keyMoments.significance: Shows strategic thinking in using specialized anti-Devil Fruit weapons

relationships.description: Serves under Vice Admiral Jonathan and executes his tactical plans

keyMoments.description: Confronts Luffy from his office balcony as the Straw Hats attempt to flee, calmly observing their movements
keyMoments.significance: Shows his composed demeanor even when facing the enemy directly

keyMoments.description: Deploys Unit 55 as a delaying tactic while Drake sets up the real ambush at Dock 88
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates his multi-layered tactical approach using diversions and traps

relationships.description: Tactical Marine antagonist attempting to capture the Straw Hat Pirates
Commands Drake and other G-8 officers
